result.execSummary:
The defendant Wesley E Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

No contact with J.V. or L.T.H. (person, property, residence or family). Comply with family court order. Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Wesley E Moore in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Plea to an amended count 1 & count 2 of Battery as PTAC; DRI count 3.
Rights Given
P- NC
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 1 & count 2 as amended; DRI count 3.

Count 1- Withheld sentence, 1 year probation

Count 2- Withheld sentence, 1 year probation

Conditions:
No contact with J.V. or L.T.H.
Comply with family court order
30 hours of community service
Provide DNA Sample + pay surcharge on count 1 only
Waive court costs
Any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent
Eligible for expungement if successfully completes probation

Defendant Wesley E Moore in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Request the jury trial date be changed to a plea / sentencing hearing.
BTC: Adj  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Wesley E Moore in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Request another status date.
BTC: Adj  Status conference scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Wesley E Moore in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Wesley E Moore in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
State requests adjournment. 
Defense does not object. 
BTC:  Adjournment granted.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Wesley E Moore in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
Defense requests adjournment. 
State does not object. 
BTC: Adjournment granted.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   ***ALSO $2,500.00 SIGNATURE BOND***   No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). LTH & JV.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Wesley E Moore in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Wesley E Moore in custody.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
